column17: The attack occurred in the Argana Caf� in the Djemma el-Fna square in Marrakech Medina, Marrakech-Tensift-El Haouz, Morocco.
column18: 04/28/2011: On Thursday, in the Djemma el-Fna square in Marrakech Medina, Marrakech-Tensift-El Haouz, Morocco, 17 people including eight French nationals, two Canadians, two Moroccans, one British man, one Dutchman, one Swiss man and one Portuguese were killed and 24 people including seven French, two Dutch, two Swiss, two Russians and two Tunisians were injured when Adil Al Athmani detonated two remote controlled improvised explosive devices (IEDs) in the Argana Caf�. Dressed as a hippie, wearing a wig and carrying a guitar, Adil Al Athmani carried the two IEDs, weighing 13 and 20 pounds, concealed in two bags into the Argana caf�. Adil Al Athmani then detonated the IEDs shortly after he left the Argana caf�. The IEDs were made of PETN, TATP, Ammonium Nitrate and nails. The caf� sustained a considerable amount of material damage. No group has claimed responsibility, but the militant group Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb was thought to be responsible for the attack.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: Two homemade explosive devices placed in bags and detonated using a cell phone werre used in the attack.
column108: The attack caused a considerable amount of property damage to the cafe.
